creditline: Gift of Loren G. Lipson, M.D.
medium: Color etching and screenprint with chine applique on glazed paper
provenance: Loren Lipson, M.D.; given to MIA, 2016
text: Emily Arthur’s art communicates themes of exodus, environmental degradation, and a world of beauty and decay. It also presents issues of Native American migration, displacement, and resiliency. In this print, birds and flowers in warm early morning light evoke a place alive with possibilities, beauty, and creation, while in the cool blue below, rats and dead flowers represent the cycle of decay necessary for the life above.
title: Black Water (with Dark Bird)
